alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:50PM EST until December 20 at 11:07AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.6 feet by Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Sat Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 16.2 Tue 7 pm EST 9.1 6.9 6.4 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued BY 10 AM Wednesday.Wednesday morning at 800 AM EST.
